docs.lead_paragraph: Spanish police say they have arrested 24 members of a Colombian drug ring seeking to establish a network for the wholesale distribution of cocaine.

headline.print_headline: Spanish Police Arrest 24 in Bust of Colombian Cocaine Ring
headline.main: Spanish Police Arrest 24 in Bust of Colombian Cocaine Ring

docs.lead_paragraph: Fabio Capello was always confident his fellow Italian Antonio Conte would be a success as Chelsea manager.    Ahead of the Premier League leaders’ trip to West Ham United on Monday, the former England manager says Conte showed signs during his coaching career in Italy that suggested he was capable of winning the English title.

headline.print_headline: Capello Not Surprised by Conte's Chelsea Success
headline.main: Capello Not Surprised by Conte's Chelsea Success

docs.lead_paragraph: Nigeria has filed criminal charges of corruption against oil multinationals Royal Dutch Shell and Eni over the $1.1 billion sale of one of Africa's richest oil blocks.

headline.print_headline: Nigeria Charges Shell, Eni With Corruption in Oil Bloc Sale

docs.lead_paragraph: North Carolina's new Democratic governor and majority Republican legislature are charging at each other in a constitutional game of chicken over their powers, a confrontation that could shape the recent conservative direction of state policies and spending.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bahrain said on Saturday it had uncovered a 54-member Iranian-linked militant group suspected of involvement in attacks on security forces, including organising a prison break in January, and seized automatic weapons.

docs.lead_paragraph: Swedish rookie Alexander Bjork and Scott Jamieson of Scotland shared the lead again at the Tshwane Open on Saturday and will take a one-shot advantage into the final round.

docs.lead_paragraph: Lazar Stojanovic, a Serbian film director who was jailed under communism and was an anti-war activist during the 1990s, has died. He was 73.

headline.main: Serbian Director Lazar Stojanovic Dies at 73
